img.alt: "Grab and Go" - Breakfast and Lunch Program UPDATE

div.a: "Grab and Go" - Breakfast and Lunch Program UPDATE

div.p:
"Grab and Go" - Breakfast and Lunch Program UPDATE
Beginning Thursday, March 26, 2020 "Grab and Go" Breakfast and Lunch Packages will be available from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM Monday - Providing 3 days of breakfast and lunch Thursday - Providing 2 days of breakfast and lunch. The pick-up locations remain the same.(9:30 AM - 12 PM now until Wednesday, March 25,...

March 20, 2020
Good Afternoon North Brunswick Township Families, As the district and students conclude their first full week of remote learning, I wanted to express my sincerest appreciation for all of your efforts and support as we commence for what looks like a long and arduous journey. These unprecedented times have challenged us in all areas of our lives,...

Township COVID-19 Briefing March 16, 2020 (Español)
READ MORE >

The latest challenge that we are facing together, Coronavirus (COVID-19), has been a source of constant trepidation due to the uncertainty surrounding this communicable virus. The district is continuing to monitor the latest news and information from the World Health Organization (WHO), Center of Disease Control (CDC), State, County and Local Health Officials...

March 13, 2020 Good Afternoon North Brunswick Township Families, The North Brunswick Township School District remains steadfast in its commitment to connect with all families and keep them apprised of the latest information. It was stated in my last communication that schools were closed through Monday, March 16. However, in an effort to give staff and families...

Township of North Brunswick COVID-19 Briefing March 13, 2020
READ MORE >

Parents and students should carefully review the parent letters together and discuss expectations for distance and digital learning each day that school is closed. ALL students are expected to continue their learning EVERY DAY and teachers will be reaching out and connecting with them daily. Parents should review online expectations and work with their students to...
READ MORE >

March 12, 2020 Good Afternoon North Brunswick Township Families, After on-going consultation with local health officials and concerns about the Coronavirus, the North Brunswick Township School District will remain closed Friday, March 13 through Monday, March 16, 2020. We continue to use an abundance of caution, despite no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in our...
READ MORE >

img.alt: NBTSchools Launching Digtial and Distance Learning Today

div.a: NBTSchools Launching Digtial and Distance Learning Today

div.p:
NBTSchools is launching digital and distance learning for students today! Stay tuned for our parent letters explaining the process and a dedicated webpage launching later this morning. Parent letters will be available on each school's news stream and our district website. Students in Grades 6-12 will be interacting with their teachers through lessons provided...
READ MORE >

March 11, 2020 Good Evening, In light of a confirmed COVID19 case in East Brunswick and an ongoing investigation of an unconfirmed case in South Brunswick, we are using an abundance of caution and closing our schools tomorrow, Thursday, March 12, 2020. All after school activities as well as before and after school LEAL will be cancelled. All staff will be...
READ MORE >
